A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
A good action movie\, a terrible Star Wars movie. A slap in the face of anybody who cares about continuity. A few exemples(SPOILER):



Finn doesn't know how to fly a ship in Ep.7\, but now he knows\, even if he's been in coma all the time.

The Mon Calamari ship is protected by shields. but it is not when they hit the deck.

No one gets sucked out when they open the door to bring back in Leia.

Luke wanted to kill Ben because he feared the dark side in him. Is this the same Luke who saw the light in HIS FATHER?! And redeemed his father in the end. And now he thinks he can't keep in the light his teen nephew?! That's not Luke. No way.

I left the cinema furious\, because it felt like the director thought I was an idiot.
